Package simmasto0.protocol

Class A_Protocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • simmasto0.protocol.A_Protocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_ConstantNumeric, I_ConstantString, I_Protocol
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    A_ProtocolFossorial, A_ProtocolTransportation, C_ProtocolCage, C_ProtocolDodel, C_ProtocolEnclosure, C_ProtocolHybridUniform
    public abstract class A_Protocol
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_Protocol, I_ConstantString, I_ConstantNumeric
    Master class for the various simmasto0.protocol of the SimMasto platform
    Author:
    Jean Le Fur & Pape Adama Mboup 07.2012, rev. JLF 02.2013, 08.2014, 10.2014

      protected void initLandscape​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context)
      The contact structure (term coined from S.E.Page: Diversity and Complexity)
      void initProtocol()
      In short: make this method first inherit its daughters at startup, then proceed to super (which is not the case within the constructor (super must be first there)
      Longer: Triggered by the context creator at the beginning of the simulation and after constructing the protocol
      The procedure can be realized only after all the CASCADING INSPECTORS and headers have been defined in the subclass hierarchy i.e., contains procedure that cannot be put in the constructor to avoid the overload when subclasses use super in their constructor
      static java.lang.Boolean isBreedingSeason()  
      boolean isSimulationEnd()
      Check if chronogram is exhausted or if a precondition is verified (e.g., population is < 2).
      protected void manageOneEvent​(C_Event event)
      Update the universe according to oneEventLine from Events
      protected void manageReadEventTypes​(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> eventTypes)
      This method must be redefined in daughter protocols
      void manageTimeLandmarks()
      Manage time, breeding season, agricultural changes
      include read user parameters
      Version Authors JEL2011, AR2011, rev.
      void printContextFullContent()
      Display the context on the output (for checking or debugging)
      void randomlyAddRodents​(int nbAgent)
      Fills the context with simple _wandering_ C_Rodent agents (as opposed to C_RodentFossorial's that dig burrows)
      The sex ratio is randomly generated , rev.
      void readUserParameters()
      reads modifiable parameters value on the GUI and fixed parameters value with initFixedParameters
      void recordHeadersInFile()
      Record the current state of every inspectors'indicators in one unique .csv indicatorsFile
      void recordIndicatorsInFile()
      Recursively record the current state of every inspectors'indicators in one unique .csv indicatorsFile
      protected int removeDeadThings()
      LIVE AND LET DIE AGENTS 2/ RODENTS'DEATH PROCEDURE
      To avoid concurrent modification exception as well as scrambling the order of rodents, all death procedure mark the rodent as having to die.
      void setLandscape​(C_Landscape landscape)  
      void setStyleAgent​(C_StyleAgent styleAgent)
      Used for switching between IMAGE true or false - JLF 08.2018
      void step_Utick()
      The clock of the simulation (live and let die): provide each A_NDS a tick
      Check sizes of the rodents'list, manage time stuff, proceed to all NDSs' step, updates indicators, remove dead agents
      Version Author J.Le Fur 2012, rev. 02.2013, 08.2014, 07.2015, 12.2015, 05.2016, 01.2018
      Tip: Object[] contextContent = RunState.getInstance().getMasterContext().toArray();
      protected void switchDisplayMap()
      Display the map if on, remove it if off.
      protected void updateUniverseFromChrono()
      Update the environment with every events (chrono) occurred at the current date.
      Triggers event management for each new event and all event types that occurred
      boolean wipeOffObject​(I_SituatedThing deadThing)
      Destroy a thing, remove it from context and remove its references to other object (lastContainerLeft, inspectors) so as to be garbage collected
      Version Jean-Emmanuel Longueville 2011-01, rev.

      • initLandscape

        protected void initLandscape​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context)

      • initProtocol

        public void initProtocol()
        In short: make this method first inherit its daughters at startup, then proceed to super (which is not the case within the constructor (super must be first there)
        Longer: Triggered by the context creator at the beginning of the simulation and after constructing the protocol
        The procedure can be realized only after all the CASCADING INSPECTORS and headers have been defined in the subclass hierarchy i.e., contains procedure that cannot be put in the constructor to avoid the overload when subclasses use super in their constructor
        Specified by:
        initProtocol in interface I_Protocol

      • step_Utick

        public void step_Utick()
        The clock of the simulation (live and let die): provide each A_NDS a tick
        Check sizes of the rodents'list, manage time stuff, proceed to all NDSs' step, updates indicators, remove dead agents
        Version Author J.Le Fur 2012, rev. 02.2013, 08.2014, 07.2015, 12.2015, 05.2016, 01.2018
        Tip: Object[] contextContent = RunState.getInstance().getMasterContext().toArray();
        Specified by:
        step_Utick in interface I_Protocol

      • updateUniverseFromChrono

        protected void updateUniverseFromChrono()
        Update the environment with every events (chrono) occurred at the current date.
        Triggers event management for each new event and all event types that occurred
        See Also:
        manageOneEvent(data.C_Event), manageReadEventTypes(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String>)

      • removeDeadThings

        protected int removeDeadThings()
        LIVE AND LET DIE AGENTS 2/ RODENTS'DEATH PROCEDURE
        To avoid concurrent modification exception as well as scrambling the order of rodents, all death procedure mark the rodent as having to die. The death and remove of dead rodents is then proceeded in one shot
        See Also:
        step_Utick()

      • wipeOffObject

        public boolean wipeOffObject​(I_SituatedThing deadThing)
        Destroy a thing, remove it from context and remove its references to other object (lastContainerLeft, inspectors) so as to be garbage collected
        Version Jean-Emmanuel Longueville 2011-01, rev. JLF 2014, 12.2015, 04.2016

      • switchDisplayMap

        protected void switchDisplayMap()
        Display the map if on, remove it if off. Only one map object. The switch can only go from on to off and vice versa Version author J.Le Fur, 09.2014
